history.content:
Take 140 if Prof Adhikari teaches it. It's challenging, but she's amazing

I second Prob 140!! The staff is amazingly knowledgeable and the material we go over (especially the labs, which are more coding-applicable) really give you a sense about how probability is useful in the real world. It is a difficult class, but I also think it can help ramp students up to eecs 126 (if they want to take that eventually)
Take 140 if Prof Adhikari teaches it. It's challenging, but she's amazing

children.subject:
Someone else might be able to comment on the difficulty, but it seems like 126 covers more applications of probability, which I guess makes sense since it's engineering instead of stats. So that might also play into your decision depending on whether you prefer applications or more pure theory.

Also, since your background is CS, are you sure that you can even enroll in 140? If you haven't already, take a look at the enrollment restrictions here http://prob140.org/about/
126 is hands down harder but that doesn't mean you will be better at probability if you take 126 over 140, just my two cents. Taking 126 rn, with friends in 140.
So do y'all think 126 is a decent amount harder than 140? It'll be my last semester at Berkeley and I really like probability, so I'd probably prefer the hardest/most in-depth class.

history.content: Has anyone taken a stats/probability class that they thoroughly enjoyed? Looking for feedback on EE126, Stats 134, or another class I haven't heard about. My background is in CS, but practical use of the material isn't necessary-- just want to take a probability course that goes a decent amount further than CS70 because I enjoy it.
history.subject: Stats/Probability Class
